meta.description:
We have entered a sometimes-unconfortable weird duality where we want an extremely personalized experience everywhere but also tend to reject any prying attempts to learn patterns of ours.
It is now up to companies and institutions to invest in two complementary and necessary venues: transparency so that the person never feels they're being misled and privacy protection methods and structures.
Not every entity has the magnitude of Facebook to withstand the loss of trust and finantial hit breach after breach.

With the slew of machine learning and AI implementations to monitor behavior and find patterns in everything, the field of personalization has never been more fertile - and people will embrace it.
The crucial factor here is to find the right balance between customer data and driving convenience - customer loyalty will reside in the entity that can meet that one consumer's demands to a T.

Customer experience is 24/7. Through chat platforms such as Whatsapp or Instagram Direct, people can easily get in touch with anyone, anywhere, and they are used to instant answers to any query. “If you can take my money 24 hours a day, you should be available to answer my questions, too.”

While the sharing economy was mostly accelerated in mobility and real estate rental, its consequences are being felt universally. This is one of the big drivers in the rise of platform organizations.
The regular user is - of course - relatively agnostic to how a service operates. The consensual shift to platforms supported by sharing economy models is explained by the sheer scalability and seamlessness that are now within reach.
To businesses operating with their core parallel to these players, it is urgent that they form partnerships, because the advantages in speed, efficiency and ease of maintenance/cost to run seem unrivalled and piling up.

Part of a greater whole, transparency has never been as present in people's minds as today. Besides paying attention to the supply chain footprint of the food we buy, society is increasingly privileging options in every field that operate in a glassdoor manner. Clothes coming from Southeast Asia resonate with humans rights violations. Users are glad to know that Apple is promising to use 100% recycled Aluminum and stride to recycle 100% in their own and (already billions) other iPhones sold.

Technology adoption among is universally attributed to Millenials and younger generations. This is partly true, but leads to a gross underestimation of tech use in older generations. Especially older urban dwellers are more than happy to adopt smart locks for safety, kitchen assistants for convenient cooking and uber to stop waiting for a taxi while it's raining.
This proves to be a greatly misrepresented segment that embodies a great business oportunity, if only companies start planning around it (remember older generations also have greater purchasing power).

There’s an increasing saturation over the massification of artificially fabricated lifestyles projected by TV, Facebook, and Instagram accounts. Many are sick of superficial treatment and fleeting connections, they crave authenticity and real-human connections.

Having an active interest in one's health. Be health consciousness implies to know what good health is and what are healthy and unhealthy practices; to monitor health condition like body weight, sleep control, sight and hearing test, mental checkups; to avoid practices that adversely affect one’s health; to take corrective actions whenever your health is not within acceptable norms.

Consumers are very aware of the impact of their purchases. Thus they want to make sure that the footprint of the products they take home is as socially and environmentally sustainable as possible. Retailers must be able to keep track of each step of the product's life cycle.
It's not just black and white anymore. The duality vegetarians/meat lovers is becoming every day more obsolete as more people start to reduce the amount of meat they consume.

Technology has finally matured enough for customers to start trusting it to avoid some of the most inefficient parts of their shopping experience. Machine learning is helping people to complete their shopping list while artificial vision is enabling the skipping of those never-ending checkout lines. Many other applications are being implemented to optimize people’s time and maximize their life quality.

The massification of online courses reflects the increasing effort that is needed nowadays to keep up with technology advancements. Knowledge is more accessible then ever, but also more volatile. Learning is a continuous process and people are looking for the right tools to keep on board of the train to the future.

Collected from renewable sources such as sunlight, wind, rain, tides, waves and geothermal heat, renewable energy is charging the future. “It is expected that by 2040 the production of renewable electricity will be able to guarantee, in a cost-effective way, the total annual electricity consumption of mainland Portugal” advanced the Portuguese Renewable Energy Association as in March 2018, renewable energy generated 104% of Portugal’s electricity consumption. According to the same source, this successful event demonstrated that “renewable energy can be relied upon as a secure and viable source with which to completely meet the country’s electricity demands”. Some of the biggest companies in the world, including Apple, Facebook, Google, and Microsoft, are massively buying renewable energy and, consequently, reshaping the entire supply chain. “The IT sector has been responsible for more than 7GW of new renewable energy globally – enough to power 5m homes” says Gary Cook, Greenpeace’s senior corporate campaigner.

Without touching the discussion topic to what caused this movement, it is unquestionably that there is a fast-rising concern for how "gut-friendly" the food we buy really is. Fashionable expressions such as pro or prebiotics are dealbreakers in the daily choices made by a growingly significant segment of society. To the unaware, the myriad of intolerances we hear about seems to have sprung from nowhere, but it certainly drove an unforeseen demand for the likes of tempeh, kefir, kimchi, flaxseed, and anything else that helps the consumer to steer clear from the wide selection of ingredients they've found harmful (think gluten, sat, unsat or trans fat, lactose, etc...).

Less than a quarter of the food that is wasted in the US, UK and Europe could feed the one billion hungry people all around the world. With an estimation of 1.3 billion tonnes of food being wasted every year, people are looking at this topic with particular concern and expect the companies where they spend their money to tackle this issue.

Total foreign residency in Portugal has been steadily rising for a few years, to a point where a significant demographic segment has different primary languages and cultures. If the current political climate remains relatively stable, this is only expected to accelerate.
With today's advances in personalization, behavior analysis and related tools, great oportunities lie in adjusting supply to a changing customer base.

Today's means of acquiring knowledge in any topic is widely different from a few years ago. Content creation in the web today has reached a granularity that allows for whomever, with whichever skillbase to quickly find informative content from the most practical topics such as "How to: fry, bake, poach and scramble eggs" to the most complex and abstract subjects in Advanced Mathematics or Quantum Mechanics.
While true volume exists mostly in english, with instant contextual translation making strides, it is all quickly being democratized to all.
This trend is being felt at the corporate level too, with Google, Apple and other powerhouses announcing that academic degrees are no longer weighted the way they were.
Companies should much rather employ someone who can quickly and effectively learn skill X when current standard Y turns obsolete than a proven expert in Y.

People will compare players, even from different industries, using the same criteria. Customers are indifferent to cost structure: if a store offers free bags, they'll expect the same treat from every other store. To stay competitive, companies should be able to optimize their cost structure and establish what's essential to provide what the customers are expecting. To do so, they must understand that people's expectations can come from the least expectable places.

names: Fluid Expectations in Placemaking: Four Trends and Strategies

meta.description: It is no secret that the portuguese demographic pyramid is getting dangerously top-heavy. What may be changing, at least in the professional market, is what companies can use to face this threat. Companies should brace for a powerful hit in the form of retirement benefits and healthcare as baby boomers maintain leadership and it simultaneously becomes harder to attract (and maintain) young talent. The uberization of every field is one way this is being tackled (or rather, circumvented), but awareness (and investment along with it) needs to increase for companies to find creative ways of facing this looming threat.

Over the last few years, society has embraced connected devices and progressively divorced traditional linear content services. Over-the-top (OTT) video from players such as Netflix, Amazon Fire TV, Apple TV or Roku had a delayed start in the Portuguese market, as is usual, but this makes it all the more relevant for side business to rethink their content design and marketing. Advertisers today have a blank canvas full of opportunities to connect with consumers in a previously impossibly organic, personalized manner.

According to ConvenienceStore, “the increase in shoppers looking for meals ‘for the next three days’ is growing with 55% of shoppers claiming to visit a convenience store for a top-up mission, 11% for a meal prep mission and 17% for food-to-go”.
As the shopping experience keeps getting more convenient, people tend to privilege smaller baskets and increase the frequency of their visits to the store. Retailers are accompanying this trend by reducing store’s dimensions, while optimizing their cost per square meter.

A social trend that has closely followed the technological advances in interfacing, it is shifting the paradigm of how we connect with machines. There is a reason babies today can outperform their parents on a tablet at the age of 2 (imagine doing that with MS-DOS in the 80s) and there will also be consequences.
For one, there will be zero tolerance for unintuitive UI, users will simply move to one of your 100 competitors for a better experience. We need to build for any human to use, with bonus points if the interface is adaptive to the individual user.

names: Intelligent interfaces - Reimagining the way humans

meta.description: No one carries cash in their pockets anymore. Even the credit card is becoming obsolete. If retailers want to guarantee maximum convenience for each step of the consumer's journey, they must be prepared to accept mobile payments.

Just like our homes need to be designed to address most of our needs, our offices must also be fully equipped to guarantee the work-life balance that we so much crave for nowadays. With that in mind, companies are beginning to re-think the isolated corporate campus model in favor of designs that attempt to create lively neighborhoods where all the employees can fulfil both their professional and personal needs and desires.

Reviews, good pictures and nice displays are not enough anymore. The biggest friction in eCommerce is the fact that, before buying a product, people still want to feel its touch, taste or smell. And whoever's capable of providing that will get the upper hand over those who can't.

Due to a variety of different factors, tourism today is more widespread than ever, and its prevalence increases by the year. This is true not only for net volume of travellers, but also variety of destinations and especially origins. As our world is experiencing the longest period of global peace in human history, and technology allows us to be a plane ride away from nearly every inch of land in our globe, nearly every culture is venturing outside its home.
Socio-economic progress, of course, closely follows tourism development.
The UNWTO estimates the business volume of tourism globally to equal or exceed that of oil exports, automobiles or food products. It is no wonder then, that this trend embodies a great deal of opportunities for businesses to cash-in on travellers who are more than willing to spend an extra coin to improve the experience they are keen to live.

According to BBC, 400 million tons of plastic is produced every year with 40% of its applications being thrown out after the first use. Plastic is not biodegradable, which means it will stay around for hundreds of years – representing a big threat for the environment. 
The debate on reducing plastic production is gathering more followers every day and people expect retailers to be a part of the process to save the world. Sustainable materials for packaging and bulk food are some of the solutions that customers value and are willing to pay extra to get.

Consumers are shifting their attention from TV to Youtube, Facebook and Instagram. Social media influencers are the new epicenter of new lifestyles, behaviors and social trends. This represents an opportunity for retailers to promote their products in a more decentralized (and effective) way. Companies who provide digital sharable products and experiences increase their reach with continuously growing scalability.

There's a clear shift from function to experience: consumers buy goods that address their needs but they also want to experience something else (see the applications Educational Retail or Insta Worthiness in this Radar). But people are also more informed than ever: our ability to understand the specific things that are good for us is continually growing. Thus, brands should be able to clearly communicate the value proposition of their products and the instant benefit of their consumption.
With enough creativity, our favorite indulgences can become a part of a healthy lifestyle. Cauliflower-based pizza? Yes, please!

The social construct that some things are more suitable for a boy than a girl (and vice versa) is completely obsolete. Brands should be aware of every little detail that their products communicate and adapt their message to the new paradigm.

A single family will probably have numerous diet restrictions: grandma is lactose intolerant, the father is gluten--free and the older daughter is trying a vegan regimen. The criteria of this family’s shopping list is almost impossible to meet – and that’s why they’ll prefer the retailer who provides them a customized service that addresses all their needs. By reducing the amount of plastic needed for packaging, bulk food is a win-win situation to the customer, the retailer, and the planet.
Today we are witnessing the democratization of luxury as middlemarket consumers are selectively trading up to higher levels of quality, taste, and aspiration.

Consumers want to know the story of the product. A study conducted by Origin/Hill Holiday found that people are willing to pay more for a product that's accompanied by a narrative - its perceived value will increase if it's followed by the producer’s story, another user's review or any other type of content that helps people relating to that particular item or service.

Consumer's attention span has been abruptly decreasing for the past few years. If a brand can't communicate its messages or value propositions in the first seconds of the conversation, people will look for something else. Customers expect to be immediately served and will have no mercy for the runner up in the delivery race. Whoever's serves first, serves better.

FOMO defines the fear of not getting in on a deal, experience, event or other activity, strongly correlated with social pressure. It is not exactly recent/emergent, but is today increasingly relevant, and is most prevalent among millenials and younger generations, in/entering prime spending age.
Marketing tends to overuse this concept to motivate consumers to do last-minute purchasing decisions. This has to be done with care, as it risks frustrating loyal customers who will then be tired of having their hand forced.
The number of offices with a desk rotation policy is increasing everywhere. Workers are valuing the convenience that flexible work stations represent, as well as the freedom to work from home.

Too much choice can be as harmful as no choice at all: just think of the time you spend trying to choose what to watch on Netflix. AI and Data mining are helping customers making some sense of the chaos with shopping list recommendations or customized campaigns.
For the keen-eyed manager, there are many unexplored opportunities to address in helping those customers who couldn't care less if they go for the 3-ply perfumed compact or the 4-ply extra-comfort toilet paper.

Schizophrenic (or non-linear) consumption portrays the fact that some consumers are willing to spend less money on some purchases so that they can dive into some other indulgences (e.g. exclusively buying white brand food to save for an iPhone). This behavior can be fostered by financial savviness or can simply be arbitrary.

The number of people with particular diets is increasing and food retailers must adapt. People want a customized service for every situation (e.g. 2 people in a couple buying 2 different meals and still eating together)
People, particularly millennials, are increasingly looking for careers with a purpose and avoiding jobs with meaningless repetitive tasks.
The fight against animal cruelty keeps gathering new supporters and some paradigms such as bullfighting and slaughterhouses may have their days counted.

The proliferation of the Gig Economy is no longer at our doors; it has entered the room completely. The current technological paradigm is allowing companies and job seekers to close the gap between labor supply and demand.

implementation.name: DAF helps supermarket giant Albert Heijn to electrify transport operations
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: DAF Trucks helps Dutch supermarket chain Albert Heijn to supply its shops electrically. It has handed over the first electric trucks to Albert Heijn carriers Simon Loos and Peter Appel Transport. It is the start of a long-term field test involving three fully electric trucks and two plug-in hybrid trucks — with the latter marking a first in Europe.

meta.description: Auto-sustainable houses have in it's conception the design to be as independent as possible and not rely on external sources. Everything is connected in a circular holistic path to reduce waste and increase yields. By applying this concept to stores, sustainability is assured and savings may occur.

implementation.name: XPrize
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: The Water Abundance XPRIZE is a competition, challenging teams to create energy-efficient technologies that harvest fresh water from thin air. Teams will revolutionize access to fresh water by creating a device that extracts a minimum of 2,000 liters of water per day from the atmosphere using renewable energy, at a cost of no more than 2 cents per liter.

implementation.name: Steps generating energy
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Abu Dhabi International Airport has officially announced the launch of an interactive walkway which converts the footsteps of travellers into off-grid electricity and data.

partner.name: CFQD® - Cadmium-free quantum dots
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: CFQD® Quantum Dot technology works by absorbing some of the LED’s light, converting it and re-emitting it with the desired color characteristics. The result is light with the color performance of an incandescent bulb and the efficiency and economy of a LED.

partner.name: Rainharvesting Systems
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Integrated into the normal drainage system, water is easily intercepted and diverted to where it is required. With appropriate filtration, the stored water may be used in a variety of ways throughout the home and garden, and has many applications for commercial, industrial and agricultural use.

partner.name: Low-E Glass
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Low-emissivity glass (or low-e glass as it is commonly referred to) is a type of energy-efficient glass designed to prevent heat escaping through the windows to the cold outdoors. Low-e glass has an invisible coating which dramatically reduces heat transfer and reflects interior heat back into the room.

partner.name: SmartWindow
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: SmartWindow controls inside systems, such as ventilation and sun blinds, based on information about the outside conditions around the building. Simultaneously these systems are powered by patented integrated solar technology, making energy consumption go down, while the sustainable electricity production of the building goes up.

partner.name: Warka Tower
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Warka Tower is a vertical structure designed to collect and harvest potable water from the air, providing an alternative water source. With photovoltaic panels, the Tower serves as a charging station.

partner.name: Nexxus Lighting
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: When excited by a light source, the dots radiate light in wavelengths that vary according to their sizes. The optic – coated with dots in specific sizes and ratios – appears orange when the light is off (left) but radiates white light when the underlying blue LED is on (right). The result: LED lamps that are 50 percent more efficient and produce better-quality white light.

partner.name: Energy OT
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: How much do you spend on electricity? Are you paying too much? When do you spend the most? Does your behaviour fit you energy plan? Knowledge is power, and in this case, power is literally money. EnergyOT is the smartest meter on the market, get one and start saving today!

partner.name: Pavegen
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Pavegen creates high engagement with citizens by converting their footsteps into energy, data and rewards. We do this for smart cities and transport hubs, retailers, brands and educators. Apps, lighting, sounds and rewards provide instant feedback.

partner.name: aquaponics Iberia
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Consultoria, Projetos e Formação em AQUAPONIA e Aquacultura sustentável

partner.name: ionseed
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Distributed Energy Storage. Your Energy. Your Rules

partner.name: HYDRAO
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: La sobriété énergétique par l'innovation, votre relais de croissance Des solutions autonomes et pédagogiques de gestion de l’eau pour mesurer et communiquer votre impact énergétique Écologie, Confort et Rentabilité

partner.name: ReVibe
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: We power the Industrial IoT by transforming vibrations into electricity. Power your IoT units without the need for standard batteries or expensive cables.

technology.name: Water harvesting for Off-grid buildings
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Harvest water from air to supply our buildings without the need of external sources of water. There are 140,000,000,000,000,000 litres of water in the atmosphere - by condensation, water can be harnessed. This method can provide enough water to supply buildings, without the need of external sources of water.

technology.name: Quantum dots for Lighting & solar cells
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Use QD to producte efficient white light in stores or to convert windows in transparent solar cells. Quantum dots are nanosized semiconductor particles that are able to absorb light and re-emit. A solar cell can have a design that uses quantum dots as the absorbing photovoltaic material.

meta.description: One man's trash is another man's treasure. The ability to add value to waste may not be a nice-to-have extravaganza any longer: it is also probably our only hope.

implementation.name: evian 100% Recycled Plastic Bottles
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Danone, Evian’s parent company, has announced that the famous mineral water from the Alps will only come in 100 percent recycled bottles in a few years, championing packaging circularity as a way of reducing plastic waste.

implementation.name: Why sustainable products are a win-win for all of us
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: The company must simply be motivated by better profits, more growth, increased employee engagement and making the world a better place. It seems like an easy choice.

partner.name: Repreve
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Recycled bottles are transformed into a fiber, used by the world's leading brands to make athletic and fashion apparel and more. The process embeds properties like wicking, adaptive warming and cooling, water repellency, and more at the fiber level. For reliable, durable quality.

partner.name: Econyl
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: The ECONYL Regeneration System is based not only on the development of a new technology but also the creation of a new supply chain specialized in the recovery of waste worldwide. The ECONYL Regeneration System is sustainable, as it recovers waste which would otherwise end up in landfills or oceans.

partner.name: Elvis & Kresse
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Rescued raw materials, World-class craftsmanship, Timeless design.

partner.name: ecodyger
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Ecodyger traite les déchets organiques sur place et permet d'en résuire le volume de 70% à 90% qu'il ne devienne des ordures. Le substrat obtenu est utilisable comme compost de haute qualité

partner.name: Frulact
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: FRULACT is a business group, established in 1987, positioned as a top-ranked innovative company in the supply of added value ingredients for the food & beverage industry, namely fruit & vegetables preps for dairy, ice-cream, desserts, beverages and plant-based alternatives.

technology.name: Sustainable materials for Textiles
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Promote sustainable materials,  manufacturing processes, and/or waste management. More sustainable materials are based on natural fibres from consciences agriculture or by recycled or recyclable synthetic fibres. More sustainable processes consume less resources such as water and produce less waste.
technology.prevwork: A study is available. Na experiment on tableware or homeware to explore some approaches is recommended.

meta.description: Learning and enabling the processes to boost the value of waste is of paramount importance. But so is the need to try to stop creating waste. And the best way to do it is by gathering all the conditions to increase the products' life cycle.

implementation.name: Made by Cow
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: This higher quality milk is bottled straight from the cows within hours and then put under intense isostatic cold water pressure, compressing both the bottle and the milk inside for several minutes. This pressure eliminates any harmful bacteria, whilst being gentler on milk’s natural nutrients.

partner.name: Woolcool
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: 100% felted sheep’s wool which is washed in a natural process, scoured then sealed within recyclable industry grade micro-perforated polyethylene wrap. Keeps food contents within various temperature windows, in Chilled, Ambient and Frozen chains, for at least 24 hours.

partner.name: Silk coating for fruit
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: A silk-based coating for strawberries is being developed at Tufts University in Massachusetts. When treated with the substance the fruits remained fresh and juicy for up to a week without refrigeration.

partner.name: Mater Dynamics
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: A smart sensor in a flexible substrate, which in a passive way (without any source of battery) can wirelessly measure external variables.

partner.name: Aspen Aerogels
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Aerogel is a synthetic porous ultralight material derived from a gel, in which the liquid component of the gel has been replaced with a gas. The result is a solid with extremely low density and low thermal conductivity. Aerogels can be made from a variety of chemical compounds.

partner.name: Innoscentia
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Printable sensor technologies for the detection of certain volatile food components that indicate the degradation of food. This sensing technology for meat packages can reveal the actual status of the packaged product. Innoscentia’s forefront technology has the potential to replace date labeling as a standard of telling how good food is feeling.

partner.name: Sensor Indicator Products
partner.author: aec
partner.description: Sensor Indicator Products offers novel solutions to issues of appropriate use, package integrity and process confirmation.

partner.name: Bio Natural Solutions
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Specialists in the development and commercialization of novel & natural preservatives for fruits and vegetables

partner.name: Evigence
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Visual indicators change color at a temperature-dependent, closely matching the actual behavior of the monitored products. The higher the temperature is, the faster the color changes. Labels can be calibrated to match different shelf-lives, ranging from hours to years.

partner.name: NaturalBlue
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: With a user friendly two-piece design, NaturalBlue is both easy to assemble and effective in maintaining critical temperature thresholds. The recycled denim insulation that powers the performance of NaturalBlue offers many advantages over traditional plastic foam products. Those advanteges are performance, drop protection, damage prevention and odor free.

partner.name: Qopius
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Digitizing Shelves Using AI-powered Computer Vision

partner.name: imago AI
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Automating your Plant Breeding Pipeline. Phenox is an AI-powered plant breeding virtual assistant providing instant measurements of the complex traits of your crops and improving breeder's experiences.

partner.name: Cambridge Crops
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Cambridge Crops develops natural and edible solutions for extending freshness.

partner.name: Hazel Technologies
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: INCREASE SHELF LIFE. DECREASE WASTE. Great things come in small packages: Meet Hazel®— the smallest, biggest thing to happen to your supply chain.

partner.name: Wasteless RFID
partner.author: aec
partner.description: Reduce food waste and increase sales with dynamic pricing

partner.name: Apeel Sciences
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: We’re passionate about helping the food system operate as a part of nature — not apart from it. Made from plants, our first family of products, Apeel, helps farmers and retailers maintain produce quality and greatly reduce food, water, and energy waste from farm to kitchen.

technology.name: Bio-plastics
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Bio-materials provide special characteristics to plastics. Innovative advanced materials are continuously in development. Those materials are derived from renewable biomass sources, such as vegetable fats and oils, corn starch, or microbiota. Most of bioplastics are biodegradable, which that under the right conditions the microbes in the environment can break down the material and use it as a food source.
technology.prevwork: A study is available with a list of technologies that can be used. Further study about the most disruptive technologies is still missing.

technology.name: Printed electronics for Disposable smart labels
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Labels with embed sensors and/or displays can help to audit the supply chain. Electrochromic displays are printable on plastic or paper to produce smart labels. These displays use almost no power (no recharging or battery replacement). They are low weight, thin, flexible, transparent, yet robust. Can be combined with sensors (e.g. movement, temperature).
technology.prevwork: A study is available. An experiment to trace the temperature of meat supply chain is being envisaged.

technology.name: Smart materials for Food security packaging
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Smart materials in food packaging can help to evaluate and preserve the freshness of food. Researchers are working in the development of materials that can protect and preserve food for longer time, such as bacteria-battling nanoparticles that are 50,000 times thinner than human hair.
technology.prevwork: YPACK is an EU-funded project with a total duration of 36 months. SONAE MC is partner of YPACK. The project aims to scale up and validate two innovative food packaging solutions based on polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHA) with active properties and passive barrier to reduce food waste by prolonging food shelf life: a fully renewable flow pack film and fully compostable tray.

technology.name: Food life extension additives
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: a
technology.prevwork: A granted project is running that explore this technology.

technology.name: Advanced materials for Thermal insulated packaging
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Use special emergent materials to avoid having to actively refrigerate food products on delivery routes. Specific materials avoid the heat loss from the inside to the outside and can prevent heat transfer to the inside, allowing products to keep their temperature for much longer.

meta.description: Long time coming, but today stronger than ever, alternatives to plastic are highly sought after, seeing as we have not found a reliable method to guarantee correct plastic waste disposal (or its recycling). With harder legislative deadlines being pushed ever so quickly, it is no longer simply good for the planet, it is becoming an operational requirement.

implementation.name: OoHo
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: Ooho is a spherical flexible packaging can also be used for other liquids including water, soft drinks, spirits and cosmetics, and our proprietary material is actually cheaper than plastic. A compound made from brown algae and calcium chloride creates a gel around the water. While the package is being formed, the water is frozen as ice, making it possible to create a bigger sphere and keeping the ingredients in the membrane and out of the water

implementation.name: Tetra Rex Bio-based
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: This package is manufactured from plastics and paperboard derived from plants, for exemple, sugarcane. Being bio-based it can biodegrade.

implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Desenvolvido por um grupo de investigação do Instituto Politécnico de Bragança, o SafeSpray quer substituir o plástico na conservação de alimentos. De origem natural e comestível, o produto foi premiado e já chamou a atenção de empresas.

partner.name: MonoSol
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: MonoSol is engineered to create individual pouches, sachets, or delivery systems that disappear and release their contents when exposed to hot or cold liquids.

partner.name: Wikicells
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Wikicells enclose food and drink inside soft skins that are entirely comprised of natural food particles held together by nutritive ions, and generally protects the soft skins with hard shells that are either completely edible (like an orange peel) or varied biodegradable (like the shell of a coconut.)

partner.name: EcoSol®
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: EcoSol® is a water soluble, biodegradable, polyvinyl alcohol (PVOH) film ideally suited for various packaging applications. Water soluble PVOH bags, sachets, or pouches created from this unique, technically advanced film provide a convenient, safe, and economical delivery system for a wide range of products.

partner.name: Bee's Wrap
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: It’s created by infusing organic cotton with beeswax, organic jojoba oil, and tree resin. This makes it biodegradable and washable, having more lifetime.

partner.name: Solubags
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: PVOH (Polyvinyl alcohol) is a synthetic polymer that degrades when is in contact with water and do not contaminate. It can be used to do plastic bags or other packagings. This hydrosoluble material has no odor and is not toxic, and is resistant to grease, oils, and solvents. PVOH is ductile but strong, flexible, and functions as a high oxygen and aroma barrier.

partner.name: Tencel
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: They are of botanic origin, since they are extracted from the raw material wood. Fiber production itself is extremely ecofriendly, due to the closed loop system. Textiles of TENCEL fibers are more absorbent than cotton, softer than silk and cooler than linen.

partner.name: TIPA
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: It feels like plastic and looks like plastic. There is just one difference: it’s fully compostable.

partner.name: Packtin
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Packtin recovers from food industries their by-products, such as orange, apple and tomato peels, spent sugar beetroots. From these by-products we extract bio-polymers and active compounds for the creation of supplements, biodegradable packaging, edible coatings and ingredients for food preservation and safety.

partner.name: Avani Eco
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: We equip customers with full range eco-friendly packaging needs all around the world.

partner.name: vegware
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Our range of eco friendly packaging and catering disposables are environmentally safe and always completely compostable. See Our Range Instore!

technology.name: Edible or water soluble films for Food packaging
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Food packed in edible packaging to deliver optimum dosing, customer convenience and sustainability. Edible or water soluble plastic film is made from the milk protein casein which guards food against oxygen, and provide more sustainable products. Transparent, odorless and tasteless pre-portioned packets streamline food and beverage manufacturing, reducing cross-contamination and dusting in kitchen or manufacturing applications. Deliver ingredients such as various food coloring, spices and oils in food-grade water-soluble film.
technology.prevwork: A study was started in the end of 2018 to explore the possibility of using this material in bags for groceries or dry products sold in bulk (e.g. fruits and vegetables).

technology.name: Bio-plastics
technology.author: radar18

technology.name: PHA - Waste Based Bioplastic
technology.author: tpc
technology.description: PolyHydroxyAlkanoates (PHA) are polyesters produced in nature by numerous microorganisms, including through bacterial fermentation of sugar or lipids. PHA have active properties and act as a passive barrier to reduce food waste by prolonging food shelf life. PHA can be produced using food industry by-products, such as cheese whey and almond shells, which assure the biodegradability and recyclability, and reduce food waste.
technology.prevwork: YPACK is an EU-funded project with a total duration of 36 months. SONAE MC is partner of YPACK. The project aims to scale up and validate two innovative food packaging solutions based on polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHA) with active properties and passive barrier to reduce food waste by prolonging food shelf life: a fully renewable flow pack film and fully compostable tray.

meta.description:
Automatic ordering and checkout is the simplest embodiment of the A-commerce trend. The aim of this application is always to rid the customer journey of all friction at the checkout and ordering stages. Subconsciously, if companies already carry so much data on consumers, why should they ever have to ask for confirmation/details on an action they've performed tens, hundreds or even thousands of times.
I've bought the same toilet paper for 3 years in a row, can the multi-million euro retailer I shop at pick up on that?

meta.description: Automated styling is the most organic practical hemisphere of automated commerce. This previously sci-fi reserved ambition, would in theory (not for long) curate a consumer's cart whenever they need an extra hand with choosing or simply aren't interested in spending time differentiating between two products. For some, shopping for a summer wardrobe is a ritual, for others a pain. Despite it all, with select products and services, a majority of people don't necessarily value time spent in choosing - think detergent, toilet paper, toothpaste. Wouldn't it be amazing to have the "just choose the cheapest one" or "get my anything whitening and minty".

meta.description:
Interfacing is a hot topic nowadays. Depending on the industry, a platform's ease of use (or lack thereof) can overturn entire business ventures. It is unquestionable that we veer towards a future where human-machine interfaces are more organic, aiming to eradicate learning curves.
Currently, voice control is, with little doubt, the closest we have to achieving the fluidity necessary for this - we certainly must teach someone what "Ctrl+A" is, and does anything interesting, but shouting "Hey Siri, play me the Beatles" comes second to language (and some good taste...).

partner.name: Trackr

technology.name: Artificial intelligence for Operations optimization
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Automate hypothesis' formulation exploiting existent data from multiple sources. AI algorithms can be used to analyse data collected from A/B testing and automatically produce outputs in accordance with previous experiments. Each problem must be addressed separately including: range definition, planogram oprimization, staff dynamic allocation, etc.
technology.prevwork: Multiple potential partners were identified that can provide AI based turnkey solutions to optimize operations. The next step is to envisage the best use case and experiment.

technology.name: Autonomous vehicles for Transportation
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Autonomous vehicles can improve delivery efficiency and logistics cost. An autonomous vehicle is one that can drive itself from a starting point to a predetermined destination in "autopilot" mode using various in-vehicle technologies and sensors, such as lasers, radar and cameras, as well as advanced driver assistance systems, software, map data, GPS and wireless data communication.

technology.name: Artificial vision for Stock management
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: AV can help retailers to manage stock more efficiently. Artificial vision promises real time analysis of video footage to monitor, control and report any visible situation with minimal-to-non-existent human intervention. By analyzing images collected in the stores it will be possible to identify out-of-stock items, low stock items, misplaced items, and pricing and planogram errors.
technology.prevwork: A study is being conducted by a team led by the BIT design area.

technology.name: Artificial intelligence for Inventory forecasting and control
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Forecast consumer demand based on sales history  fused with other data sources such as weather. Machine learning and optimization algorithms can look for and exploit observed patterns, correlations, and relationships among data elements and supply chain decisions – e.g., when to order a widget, how many widgets to order, where to put them, and so on. Such algorithms can be trained and tested using past data.

technology.name: Big data analytics for Business Intelligence
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Get customer insights using multiple data sources such as mobility, communication or demographics data. By gathering data from different sources, such as banks, communications or demographic data, a costumer profile can be defined and tendencies be revealed through complex algorithms. This can help to easily adapt the business to a target audience.
technology.prevwork: The use of mobility data from NOS is being considered to predict the purchasing power of populations served by stores.

technology.name: Internet of things for Smart farming
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: IoT smart farming strategies can be applied to optimize food production and provide traceability. Through smart farming it is possible to increase both the quantity and the quality of agricultural products, as wells as the intelligence of farms. Collecting massive amounts of information, from soil mapping, crop fields, weather data and more, using specialized sensors will help in having a better productivity.

technology.name: Artificial intelligence for Retail fraud detection
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Machine learning-based models can be used to automatically detect anomalies in cash transactions. While in the process of verification of cash transactions, machine learning-based models are used to mine data and detect anomalies in those transactions.
technology.prevwork: Multiple potential partners were identified that can provide AI based turnkey solutions to detect fraud in payments. The next step is to envisage the best use case and experiment.

technology.name: Artificial intelligence for Predictive maintenance
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Predict when equipment maintenance is needed based on operational data such as energy consumption. Analytical models are applied to operational data enriched with additional context such as environmental information and workload data, in order to predict the risk of asset failure at any point in time.
technology.prevwork: Multiple potential partners were identified that can provide AI based turnkey solutions to promote predictive maintenance. The next step is to envisage the best use case and experiment.

technology.name: Artificial intelligence for Price optimization
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Pricing according with consumer demand, past sales, weather or external events. Machine learning-based models can mine data (internal and external data in the cloud) automatically to uncover patterns and insights. Pricing decisions take into account competitive, seasonal, meteorological, and geographic context in real time.
technology.prevwork: Multiple potential partners were identified that can provide AI based turnkey solutions to optimize pricing. The next step is to envisage the best use case and experiment.

technology.name: E-paper for Electronic shelf labels
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Replace paper with e-paper based labels to save staff time, improve information accuracy, and speed up pricing strategy deployment. With this tech the images are shown through e-ink, where a group of microcapsules contains tiny black or white spheres that are positioned according to the eletric charge driven through the material.
technology.prevwork: An experiment is being conducted by BIT design department.

technology.name: Indoor positioning
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Retailers can precisely locate customers and provide them an improved experience. Technology such as Li-Fi, Beacons, ultrasounds, Wi-Fi, dead reckoning and others, are used to create indoor positioning systems. These systems allow retailers to locate customers and allow customers to navigate in-store and easily find items. An indoor positioning system is also essential for autonomous robots to navigate in-store.
technology.prevwork: A study is available. An experiment is being conducted by Innovation department in collaboration with Digital department.

technology.name: Robotics for In-store assistance
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Robots can automate simple in-store tasks and provide help to customers. Specific robots can assist customers to achieve their needs, perfoming the tasks more quickly and efficiently, improving customer service and satisfaction.
technology.prevwork: An experiment was done in the past to use WiiGo, a follow me robot, in the store to assist low mobility customers. Further use cases may be explored

technology.name: Collaborative robots for Food production
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Robots can be applied to a variety of food production systems working in parallel with the human workforce to improve performance.

technology.name: Collaborative robots for Product handling
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Robots can perform heavy, time-consuming or repetitive tasks e.g. assemble ice in fishery stand. Robots can perform a wide variety of tasks, including selection, transferring, packing, palletizing, loading and unloading, machine feeding or disengaging. These tasks can be fully automized by robots, freeing workers for more complex tasks

technology.name: Advanced materials for Construction
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Safer and durable flooring, wall covering, and structures for stores. Smart materials are engineered to respond to environmental stimuli such as temperature, pressure, and presence of oxygen. These materials help make buildings and structures safer and more durable.

technology.name: Sensors for Food quality analysis
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Specific low cost sensors can analyse the quality of food outside labs. Innovative technologies are being developed to analyse the overall quality of food, including their grade of maturation (in the case of fruit), molecular composition, presence of contaminants, and other characteristics.
technology.prevwork: Some devices were experimented in the past but none presented reliable results. Further study must ne done.

technology.name: Sensors for Tracking objects
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Track containers, tools, and other assets by installing communication sensors in this objects . Sensors equipped with tracking systems register position and then send that information by wifi, bluetooth, infrared or even radio.

technology.name: Mixed reality for Training
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Training/picking info in embedded in virtual objects that are superimposed over the real environment in warehouses. By using VR, specific environments are created simulating the real world. With AR the real environment can be augmented by showing in site more information that leads and helps the user to make it's task.
technology.prevwork: The school of logistics relaunched in January 2019 uses mixed reality in one of the introduction modules. The development of this module is an experiment that can be replicated for other modules and schools.

technology.name: Drones for Deliveries
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Unmanned aerial vehicles can deliver packages to customers in short periods of time, taking advantage of the zero-congestion and more direct air routes (at least for now).
technology.prevwork: A study is available. Drones are lacking maturity to be used for last mile deliveries.

technology.name: Drones for Inventory control & surveillance
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Automated vehicles, such as ground or flying drones with motion sensors and 3D cameras, screen and analyze the interior of the warehouse performing inventory identification, management and surveillance.

technology.name: Advanced materials for Thermal insulated packaging
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Use special emergent materials to avoid having to actively refrigerate food products on delivery routes. Specific materials avoid the heat loss from the inside to the outside and can prevent heat transfer to the inside, allowing products to keep their temperature for much longer.

meta.description: One can simply look over to China for cases of this application, but it is easily explained by the shift in the role brick-and-mortar increasingly plays in society: it is no longer the convenient option (that part will be played by e-commerce), people expect to be wowed and to be assisted when going through the effort of going to a physical store. The physical world is needed for knowledgeable advice on a brand's product range and for consumers to get hands-on with what they are looking for in an inspiring setting.

An autonomous vehicle is one that can drive itself from a starting point to a predetermined destination in "autopilot" mode using various in-vehicle technologies and sensors, such as lasers, radar and cameras, as well as advanced driver assistance systems, software, map data, GPS and wireless data communication.

technology.name: Artificial intelligence for Smart checkout
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Customers can grab the products and leave the store without stopping while avoiding shoplifting. To achieve a secure and fraudproof seamless checkout, various sources of data must be fused. Images are the main data source to learn costumer behaviour and product placement complemented by other sensors such as biometric, thermal radiation or RFID.
technology.prevwork: SONAE is approaching some companies (Sensei and Trigo Vision) to explore the possibility of test the staff less store concept with our customers.

technology.name: Augmented reality for Extended product information
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Additional information about a product is diplayed by pointing the camera at the object. The details appear on screen, giving extra information that isn't on the label.
technology.prevwork: BIT did a proof-of-concept of this technology.

technology.name: Artificial intelligence for Recommendations
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Customize advirtisement and product recommendation based on sales history and custom behaviour. Machine learning and optimization algorithms can look for and exploit observed patterns, correlations, and relationships among data elements of customer’s purchases. In this way, automatic suggestion of discounts based on previous and continuous purchases.
technology.prevwork: Smart Continente and Siga APP uses AI to make suggestions to add items to a list. The next step is to envisage the best additional use cases to incorporate this technology in other applications in the company and implement.

technology.name: Big data analytics for Business Intelligence
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Get customer insights using multiple data sources such as mobility, communication or demographics data. By gathering data from different sources, such as banks, communications or demographic data, a costumer profile can be defined and tendencies be revealed through complex algorithms. This can help to easily adapt the business to a target audience.
technology.prevwork: The use of mobility data from NOS is being considered to predict the purchasing power of populations served by stores.

technology.name: NFC for Extended product information
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: NFC allows customers to interact and fully engage with products instore. NFC equipped mobile phones allow for the retrieval of information via information beacons, creation of  ‘virtual’ sales people or coupons in real time. Customers can check online reviews that help in their purchase.

technology.name: Indoor positioning
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Retailers can precisely locate customers and provide them an improved experience. Technology such as Li-Fi, Beacons, ultrasounds, Wi-Fi, dead reckoning and others, are used to create indoor positioning systems. These systems allow retailers to locate customers and allow customers to navigate in-store and easily find items. An indoor positioning system is also essential for autonomous robots to navigate in-store.
technology.prevwork: A study is available. An experiment is being conducted by Innovation department in collaboration with Digital department.

technology.name: Robotics for In-store assistance
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Robots can automate simple in-store tasks and provide help to customers. Specific robots can assist customers to achieve their needs, perfoming the tasks more quickly and efficiently, improving customer service and satisfaction.
technology.prevwork: An experiment was done in the past to use WiiGo, a follow me robot, in the store to assist low mobility customers. Further use cases may be explored

technology.name: Mixed reality for Training
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Training/picking info in embedded in virtual objects that are superimposed over the real environment in warehouses. By using VR, specific environments are created simulating the real world. With AR the real environment can be augmented by showing in site more information that leads and helps the user to make it's task.
technology.prevwork: The school of logistics relaunched in January 2019 uses mixed reality in one of the introduction modules. The development of this module is an experiment that can be replicated for other modules and schools.

technology.name: Drones for Deliveries
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Unmanned aerial vehicles can deliver packages to customers in short periods of time, taking advantage of the zero-congestion and more direct air routes (at least for now).
technology.prevwork: A study is available. Drones are lacking maturity to be used for last mile deliveries.

technology.name: Virtual reality for Showrooming
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Visit virtual spaces (e.g. new stores) to anticipate their appearance  or show long tail range to customers. People from around the world can meet into the same virtual space by using specific devices, such as appropriate virtual reality glasses. In retail, customers could use this approach to be in a specific virtual place with a specialist in a determined issue and obtain special information and different visions about some items present in the store.
technology.prevwork: Multiple partners are available to implement a test with this technology. The adequate use case should be envisioned.

implementation.author: tpc

Once a hearing aid shell has been finished on the computer, the file with the three-dimensional structure is stored in a central database and transmitted to the 3D printers at the production site. Layer upon layer of light-curing acrylic resin appears to be built up from nothing to form the new hearing aid shell.

This is possible using ALYSIA, a songwriting AI enabling software created by WaveAI that allows anyone to create original songs in minutes.

The production of cultured meat begins by incubating cells in a media that is rich in nutrients. Those nutrients help the cells thrive and divide. It is biologically the same as the meat that comes from animals. Our products will be non GMO and with no animal products besides the original cells.

technology.description: Eggs can have a substitute themselves or be used for it’s broad features. A lot of products and recipes use eggs, and therefore there is a need to replace egg’s binding function, texture addition, or nutrient enrichment with vegetable sources.

technology.name: Vegetable protein isolation for Meat substitutes
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Have vegetable based produtcs with the same nutrients set and taste  as meat or fish. Soy protein is globular while actual meat protein is fibrous, so food manufacturers alter the soy's molecular structure. This is typically done by exposing the soy protein to heat, acid or a solvent and then running the mixture through a food extruder that reshapes it. But soy isn't the only way to create meat-like products.
technology.prevwork: A internal project, Food Lab, is exploring readymade alternatives for hamburgers with Food Private Labels and H&W department.

technology.name: Non-animal protein isolation for Milk free dairy
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Have vegetable or yeast based products with the same taste and nutrients set as animal based dairy products. The dairy industry is responsible for thousands of products, replacing milk is done recurring to vegetable sources and treating them to resemble the originals in either shape, texture, cooking behaviour or flavour. Most dairy-free substitutes are made with yeast, soy protein, textured vegetable protein (TVP) or nuts oils

technology.name: Insects for New foods
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: New foods are being developed to respond to consumer demand  . Edible insects contain high quality protein, vitamins and amino acids for humans. Insects have a high food conversion rate, needing less feed than animals to produce the same amount of protein.
technology.prevwork: An internal project, Food Lab, is exploring readymade alternatives for pasta and snacks with Food Private Labels and H&W department. DGAV denied to the request to commercialize insects.An internal project, Food Lab, is exploring readymade alternatives for pasta and snacks with Food Private Labels and H&W department. DGAV denied to the request to commercialize human food with insects. Further lobby must be done to go further with this project.

technology.name: Cell growth for Meat substitutes
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Products made of muscle cells that never been inside of an animal - same taste, nutrient and texture as meat. It is a form of cellular agriculture. Cultured meat is produced using many of the same tissue engineering techniques traditionally used in regenerative medicine. Through this technique muscle tissue is produced, having this way cultured meat.

implementation.name: OoHo
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: Ooho is a spherical flexible packaging can also be used for other liquids including water, soft drinks, spirits and cosmetics, and our proprietary material is actually cheaper than plastic. A compound made from brown algae and calcium chloride creates a gel around the water. While the package is being formed, the water is frozen as ice, making it possible to create a bigger sphere and keeping the ingredients in the membrane and out of the water

implementation.name: Bel cheeses snack
implementation.author: man
implementation.description: Bel Brands is at it again with two new cheese snacks that are "grate"™ as a mid-afternoon energy boost or as a lunchbox.

partner.name: Chill Can
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Chill-Can has a built in heat exchange unit which contains the technology necessary to chill the drink in under a minute. Upon activation (pressing the button), the patented technology activates the environmentally safe reclaimed Co2 in the HEU that leads to the chilling of the beverage.

partner.name: HeatGenie / HeatGen
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: HeatGenie is a self-heating package that used solid-fuel technology within a modular heat source. After pushing the button the product heats a coffee or soup in 2 minutes.

partner.name: MonoSol
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: MonoSol is engineered to create individual pouches, sachets, or delivery systems that disappear and release their contents when exposed to hot or cold liquids.

partner.name: Wikicells
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Wikicells enclose food and drink inside soft skins that are entirely comprised of natural food particles held together by nutritive ions, and generally protects the soft skins with hard shells that are either completely edible (like an orange peel) or varied biodegradable (like the shell of a coconut.)

technology.name: Smart materials for Self-cooling packaging
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Active packaging with the ability to cool down food contents without external power sources. Cooling is achieved by an endothermic reaction that the user initiates by pressing on the bottom of the can.  A container for the beverage surrounds a container of the cooling agent separated from a container of water by a thin breakable membrane. The resulting reaction consumes heat and thus colds the product surrounding it.
technology.prevwork: A study is available. We are currently looking for a viable partner to run a proof-of-concept

technology.name: Edible or water soluble films for Food packaging
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Food packed in edible packaging to deliver optimum dosing, customer convenience and sustainability. Edible or water soluble plastic film is made from the milk protein casein which guards food against oxygen, and provide more sustainable products. Transparent, odorless and tasteless pre-portioned packets streamline food and beverage manufacturing, reducing cross-contamination and dusting in kitchen or manufacturing applications. Deliver ingredients such as various food coloring, spices and oils in food-grade water-soluble film.
technology.prevwork: A study was started in the end of 2018 to explore the possibility of using this material in bags for groceries or dry products sold in bulk (e.g. fruits and vegetables).

technology.name: Smart materials for Self-heating packaging
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Ready to eat food can deliver aditional convenience if the package can heat the food. The source of the heat for the self-heated packaging is an exothermic reaction initiated by the user. A container for the beverage surrounds a container of the heating agent separated from a container of water by a thin breakable membrane.
technology.prevwork: A study is available. We are currently looking for a viable partner to run a proof-of-concept

meta.description: Provide a range of products that ease the health monitoring. A range of services that take advantage of these health monitoring devices such as sleep advising.

implementation.name: Sonova - ear canals
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: Silicone impressions of the ear canal (which are still taken by hand) are scanned into the computer using laser technology. Once a hearing aid shell has been finished on the computer, the file with the three-dimensional structure is stored in a central database and transmitted to the 3D printers at the production site. Layer upon layer of light-curing acrylic resin appears to be built up from nothing to form the new hearing aid shell.

implementation.name: Kinsa Baby Thermometer

It also provides information about diseases going around at the child’s school and local area.

implementation.name: Owlet
implementation.author: tpc

implementation.name: Amblyz electronic glasses
implementation.author: tpc

implementation.name: Vital Connect VitalPatch

implementation.name: Sharp’s smart cat litter

Developed by Abbott Diabetes Care, the patch measures glucose levels in the interstitial fluid between the cells right under the skin.

partner.name: Juvo
partner.author: tpc

partner.name: Percko
partner.author: tpc

It does this all without any electronics nor a mobile app.

The determination of genomic drivers of cancer and the varied combinations of genomic alterations within each disease allows the development of targeted therapies.

implementation.name: FoodPrint
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: "Nutrino collects data on both food composition and individuals' health and, through its trademarked FoodPrint technology, combines the two to analyse how people's bodies react to different foods. It then makes personalised suggestions, recommending the foods that are the healthiest possible choices for the individual in question."

meta.description: While many consumers are actively making the choice to reduce or avoid certain foods (think anything dairy, gluten, eggs, meat…), a significant lot would happily resume their intake if they could. This represents a great part of the appeal in pro+prebiotics, where you healthily repopulate the gut microbiome and feed it as well, to hopefully lead a non-eventful gut-routine and maybe even ease or eliminate some of your intolerances and sensitivities.

implementation.name: Kelloggs Hi Happy Inside
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: Give your insides what they need with this new, delicious cereal brought to you by the W.K. Kellogg Institute.

partner.name: A2 Milk
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: A2 milk is cow's milk that mostly lacks a form of β-casein proteins called A1 and instead has mostly the A2 form which many believe causes the same gut problems as lactose intolerance. The australian A2 Milk Company claims that this milk is a result of breeding, not GMOs, brough this product to the market and has 10% of milk market share in Australia.

partner.name: Cuisine Soleil

Since 2017, strated a metamorphosis. It set up an agri-food facility in Val-d'Or (Québec), where it now develops new innovating products such as gluten-free flour made of millet, coconut or buckwheat. Cuisine Soleil received the Food Innovation Award from the Council of Food Manufacturing of Québec (CTAQ) and the Organic Innovator of the Year Award from the Canadian Organic Tade Association (COTA)

meta.description:
One of the most significant parts contributing to Privacy Protection as a whole, is the preventive avoidance of data leaks, attacks, phishing, fraud, etc... This is the first line of defense, and it should go without saying that consumers only rest assured when they trust this is taken care of. Besides, although it is hard to measure return on investment for prevention, it is certainly cheaper than the PR crises and loss of trust that happens when it fails. Every company today should stop and think if they are prioritizing encryption, collecting only needed data, and the myriad of other good practices that so many neglect in place of cost reduction or marketing stunts.

An equally important side to transparency is how a brand behaves in case of data compromise or any attack. For the most part, what is increasingly being adopted is full transparency, in opposition of quiet diffusal. Addressing isues that were not planned for, publicly/semi-publicly, builds trust and meets a more understanding consumer base, instead of coming accross as deception and losing valuable client and industry loyalty.

technology.name: Blockchain for Financial services
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Blockchain promises to revolutionise transactions on the internet, by avoiding intermediaries. A distributed database maintains a list of data blocks secured from tampering and revision. Each block holds batches of individual transactions, a timestamp and a link to a previous block. When a block is created, a copy is distributed across all systems. No centralized "official" copy exists and no user is "trusted" more than others.

technology.prevwork: A study was conducted in collaboration with Everis showing that there is no need yet to blockchain in our supply chain traceability. The digitalization of these processes have precedence over the introduction of blockchain technology.
