partner.name: Upright
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Smart wearable posture trainer recommended by physicians and chiropractors with proven success in decreasing back pain and increasing productivity.

partner.name: Wear Kinetic
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: This wearable technology analyzes workers' posture and movements in real time, and gives feedback to help them develop healthier habits. The system contain two components: a device that is attached to workers belt and a dashboard that allows decision makers to track the behavior through the days.

partner.name: TruPosture
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: TruPosture is an advanced posture tracking and training technology built into a discreet undershirt. It gets an extremely accurate measure of the shape of the two major curves of your spine by placing an array of five miniature measuring devices along your back.

partner.name: Superflex exosuit
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: A powered exosuit to augment the musculoskeletal system for performance and strength enhancement and assistance to overcome or prevent damage from injury or disease.

partner.name: SuitX
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: The Phoenix exoskeleton is the world's lightest and most advanced exoskeleton designed to help people with mobility disorders to be upright and mobile.

partner.name: Laevo
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: This exoskeleton distributes the load through various zones in the body avoiding overload a certain area. It can also capture energy in springs and act as dampers to facilitate movement.

technology.name: Wearables for Posture monitoring
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Wearables to control the posture in our daily activities and prevent employee injuries. Specific sensors embedded in the wearables can monitor personal activity and identify hazardous conditions in the work environment. In this way, wearable technology can have a meaningful impact on costs through injury prevention.
technology.prevwork: A pilot for experimentation of Wear Kinetic's devices was performed on two of SONAE's warehouses.

technology.name: Exoskeletons
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Exoskeletons to complement orthopaedic treatment or to assist in physically-heavy tasks in operations. Wearable devices are used to improve the life and everyday activities of people with reduced mobility and with heavy tasks by using robotics and other devices that fit our bodies.
technology.prevwork: A study about exoskeletons and other wearable for injury prevention is available. Currently an experiment in under discussion.

technology.name: Bionic lenses
technology.author: aec
technology.description: Bionic lenses, while still not a mature technology, has an ambitious comcept. To restore perfect vision, at all distances, with no glasses or contact lenses. They auto-regulate to allow for focusing as intended.

implementation.name: Lowe's Exosuits
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: In partnership with the Assistive Robotics Lab at Virginia Tech, we kicked off the exosuit pilot with stock employees at Lowe's of Christiansburg, VA in April of 2017.

implementation.name: Samsung GEMS
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: Samsung GEMS (Gait Enhancing & Motivating System) can assist users who have trouble walking, running or standing up, such as the elderly, by preventing their muscles from being overworked.

implementation.name: Barclays Bolder Apprenticeship
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: When it comes to your potential, age just isn’t a factor for us. There’s no upper limit on any of our opportunities, whether you’re 55 or 85. It doesn’t matter whether you’re returning to work after early retirement or raising a family, looking for a career change, or stepping into finance for the first time.

implementation.name: Daimler Aging Exhibition
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: EY AGE - #eyalter. The interactive exhibition in the Gasometer on the EUREF Campus Berlin Schöneberg.

implementation.name: Hyundai H-CEX & H-VEX
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: Hyundai Motor Group has ventured further into the high-value robotics industry of the future by commencing development of Hyundai Vest Exoskeleton (H-VEX) wearable industrial robots.

implementation.name: SAP Mature Talents Program
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: The SAP initiative "mature talents" wants to support cooperation across generations and help managers understand the needs of different age groups.

meta.description: Making part-time or freelance job opportunities available to retirees to overcome scarcity of labour and allow them an extra income stream and a renewed sense of purpose.

implementation.name: Fast Food Golden Gigs
implementation.author: nlg
implementation.description: Restaurants are recruiting in senior centers and churches. They’re placing want ads on the website of AARP, an advocacy group for Americans over 50. Recruiters say older workers have soft skills—a friendly demeanor, punctuality—that their younger cohorts sometimes lack.

implementation.name: How to Cash In On the Untapped Longevity Economy
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: The 50+ crowd desires to chase their dreams, have fun, contribute, socialize, achieve meaning, and leave a legacy.

implementation.name: You Say Silver Tsunami, I Say Longevity Economy
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: In today’s booming economy and tight labor market, employees are no longer simply a clock number. In fact, industrial gerontology is a leading field in the longevity economy and rife for continued innovation and development. “Every old is new again,” after all.

implementation.name: The “silver tsunami” is the workforce the world needs right now
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: However, a silver tsunami has already arrived, but with much less fanfare. It has shown itself not in the number of pensioners, not in the number of consumers, but in the number of employees.

meta.description:
While Flexible Workplaces are an unquestionable trending success, there is always going to be a core type of work that gravitates around physical headquarters. There is a parallel trend turning corporate headquarters into small cities. Whether it is one of the FAANG giants or a group of smaller companies, workers rejoice when finding all amenities within walking distance from work.
Forgot your allergy meds? Take a break and visit the pharmacy. Sick of traffic? Get up early and use that time in the work gym instead. Need to restock groceries? Walk by the supermarket when you get off.

implementation.name: Carrefour Corda Campus
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: Carrefour Drive opens a first pick-up point on a technology campus in Belgium

implementation.name: Carrefour RTBF
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: French grocery giant Carrefour has launched an after-work pick-up point for goods in Belgium. The facility gives workers at RTBF and VRT in Schaerbeek, Belgium, the opportunity to order online and then pick up their purchases in the companies’ shared on-site car park.

implementation.name: Hamburger University
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: McDonald's new headquarters is part of the Golden Arches' push to become a "more modern and progressive burger company," a long-standing goal of CEO Steve Easterbrook.

partner.name: Workwell
partner.author: aec
partner.description: The all-in-one app that brings people together, one place at a time. Use our built-in services, or build your own. Seamless third-party integrations.

meta.description: Design has been long associated with gender. Genderless design is interpreted as a design style that breaks stereotypes associated with gender-norms. This is not exclusive to fashion, being easily applied to food for example, in the low-carb/light and healthy categories, that are no longer just a female worry.

implementation.name: Nike Self-lacing Shoes
implementation.author: jgp

implementation.name: Brandless

implementation.name: The genderless digital voice the world needs right now
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: The problem is, that binary choice isn’t an accurate representation of the complexities of gender. Some folks don’t identify as either male or female, and they may want their voice assistant to mirror that identity.

implementation.name: New York Fashion Week Is Moving Toward a Genderless Future
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: “The future is female” might be the feminist slogan of the moment, but in the world of fashion, the future is neither female nor male — it’s genderless.

meta.description: Include cruelty free products in the assortment. Sourcing this type of producer can by simply scouting those who already have the approach in place, or training producers already partnered into creating this paradigm, ever more present in the consumer's mind.

implementation.name: Geltor Vegan Collagen
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: N-Collage is described by CEW as the first ever animal-free, high-performance collagen for cosmetics. Geltor achieves its product by programming microbes that then produce collagen.

implementation.name: Carrefour Audits
implementation.description: Carrefour will audit meatpacking refrigerators bearing the brand name of the French group and ask them to install cameras in response to growing consumer demand for socially responsible practices.

implementation.name: Tesco Humane Fish Slaughter
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: Turkey’s largest bass and bream farmer Kilic is currently testing the new slaughtering system developed by Tesco and will kick it off soon for 1,000t of production.

partner.name: Poulehouse egg that doesn't kill the hen
partner.author: man
partner.description: Innovative concept and respectful of all forms of life, Poulehouse offers the first egg that does not kill the chicken with a slaughter-free mode of production.

partner.name: Bee Approved
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Honey is an animal product and therefore, not suitable for vegans. It is produced by bees for themselves and not for human use. Our first product, Bee Approved* looks and tastes like honey but, most importantly, no bees are harmed in its production.

meta.description: While brands develop communication to be inspiring and convince customers that they are guided by the correct values, different awareness campaigns may be created and supported.

implementation.name: TheBodyShop Forever Against Animal Testing
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: We at The Body Shop are forever against animal testing - help us to convince the government that product testing on animals should be banned in the USA.

meta.description: People spend a lot of time scrolling through their social media feeds. Create calls to action to drive sales.

technology.name: Digital printing for In-store textile customization
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Customize garments in-store using digital printing in textiles or 3D printing in accessories. Digital printers can be used to print customized patterns in clothes or shoes. 3D printers can provide customized buttons, zipper pulls, eyelets, or other ornaments
technology.prevwork: There are multiple mature solutions in the market that may be integrated in existing services.

partner.name: Tubular Labs to manage Nano-Influencers
partner.author: tpc

partner.name: Instagram Stickers
partner.author: aec
partner.description: Instagram Stories stickers are not just a fun way to add more personality to your stories — they’re also extremely useful for growing your businesses!  Whether you’re trying to grow your engagement, build more brand awareness, drive traffic to your website, or even make ecommerce sales, there’s definitely an Instagram Stories sticker that can help you along the way.

partner.name: Traackr
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Traackr is a influencer analytics firm that provides one system-of-record for influencer discovery, management and analytics to scale the impact of influencer relationships across your organization. They have proprietary data to measure reach, or audience size; resonance, or propensity for virality; and relevance, or engagement related to their area of expertise.

implementation.name: Sainsbury's Food with Fleur and Mike

implementation.description: Food With Fleur & Mike is Sainsbury's Youtube channel starring beauty and fashion vlogger Fleur De Force and her husband, Mike, trying new recipes for the first time or attempting to cook some of their favorite dishes. Each video scores around 25,000-50,000 views.

implementation.name: Instagram’s Long-Awaited Checkout Feature Is Finally Here
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: After rolling out a series of shopping features over the past year, Instagram is finally debuting its ultimate retail tool: checkout.

implementation.name: Instagram’s New Shopping Tool Will Likely Be a Boon for Influencers
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Instagram’s newest tool for creators lets them tag products in their posts, making it easier for users to shop some of their favorite looks from their favorite influencers.

meta.description: Vlogging has undeniable power, akin to old-timey blogging and their respective influencer community. This is the more organic way of keeping up with friends, celebs or anyone you follow and for a good reason, it is more authentic, personal, human - often even done live for an interactive experience, in essence, a simultaneous conversation with thousands of fans/friends/followers.

implementation.name: Maybelline's #DaretoNude Vlgging campain
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: Understanding the target’s affinity for beauty tutorials, Maybelline recruited 13 popular beauty vloggers to bring the message to life. They challenged each to create a how-to video of their signature look using the Nudes Palette. Two weeks after the teaser, the beauty brand introduced all 13 YouTube videos and housed them on a microsite, along with vignettes to give viewers a peek at their inspiration and process.

implementation.name: Getting YouTube Stars to Sell Your Product
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: YouTube influencers are a sought-after breed. One word from these connoisseurs of cool, these heralders of hipness, and traffic to a website or store soars, products fly off shelves and brands become blockbusters overnight.

meta.description:
If it's worth a "like", it's worth a visit. The value proposition of a brand is not exclusively inherent to its products or services anymore. The surroundings count.
Design every product and service so that consumers would want to be be seen using them. A good portion of your brand marketing will become self-sufficient.

implementation.name: Museum of Ice Cream
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: In the summer of 2016, ice cream lover Bunn opened her first 45-day pop-up Museum of Ice Cream in New York, featuring art installations and a pool of multicolored plastic sprinkles. An instant hit, it left 200,000 people on the waitlist.

implementation.name: Unicorn Frappuccino mania: Starbucks aims at Instagram
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Coffee chain enhances profile with selfie-friendly Unicorn Frappuccino. It tastes awful, say some – but looks great on social media

implementation.name: The 15 most Instagrammable restaurants in the world
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: These are the spots people would still go for the ‘gram even if all that was served was hardtack.

implementation.name: Why are fancy bathrooms all over Instagram?
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Hotels and restaurants are hoping you’ll take a selfie in one of their novelty bathrooms.

meta.description:
With robotics taking center stage on logistics, it has never felt worse to wait several days for a parcel, only to have it be returned automatically because the delivery truck appeared outside the already 12-hour long designated period for delivery.
There are cities today where it is second nature to order groceries for the family a half hour before dinner, right when you leave work. If this is possible there with fresh groceries, to the demanding consumer, it should be possible anywhere, with anything.

implementation.name: Amazon PrimeAir
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: A future delivery system from Amazon designed to safely get packages to customers in 30 minutes or less using small unmanned aerial vehicles. Amazon Prime Air is testing their drones in Canada, United Kingdom, and the Netherlands.

implementation.name: Deliveries Ecosystem
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: Amazon is recruiting entrepreneurs to expand its network of partners for last mile delivery. This reduces the risk associated with relying on powerful courrier operators such as DHL or UPS. Amazon provide services to partners such as training, insurance packs or privileged access to vehicles.

implementation.name: Kiva
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: Amazon’s Kiva robot can run at a steady 5 mph and haul packages weighing up to 700 pounds.

implementation.name: Alibaba Drone Deliveries
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: China's biggest internet retailer already started testing drone-based deliveries to hundreds of customers. During three days, drones were used to deliver orders for a specific type of ginger tea, helping limit the maximum weight of the packages to 340g.

implementation.name: Hema Fresh 1/2 Hour Deliveries
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: Hema is a grocery store chain operated by Alibaba that provides half-hour deliveries using Robots, apps and overhead conveyor belts to speed up the picking process. Groceries are collected by one of the multitude of delivery service companies existing in 1st tier Chinese cities and quickly get the parcel to the delivery address on a moped.

implementation.name: Chipotle/Eatsa Food Pickup Shelves
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: We’re ordering more and more delivery, and restaurants aren’t designed for it. Some companies are rethinking their spaces to cope.

implementation.name: Kroger Driverless Cars to Deliver Groceries
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: The nation’s largest grocery chain stepped into the driverless delivery market Tuesday, bringing milk, eggs and other items to a customer’s home in a vehicle...

implementation.name: GM’s Cruise partners with DoorDash to test autonomous food delivery
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: Cruise Automation, the self-driving unit of General Motors, is teaming up with DoorDash to test a food delivery service in San Francisco using autonomous vehicles.

implementation.name: Ford self-driving cars shift from pizza delivery to Walmart order pickup
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: Ford said by the end of 2019 autonomous Walmart deliveries will expand to 100 regions in the U.S. at 800 Walmart stores. In 2019, Ford says at least 1,600 Walmart stores will offer self-driving deliveries.

implementation.name: Pizza Delivery Gears Up for a Driverless Era
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: Domino’s Pizza Inc. doubled down on a partnership with Ford Motor Co. earlier in 2018, saying it would be part of the auto maker’s test run for how driverless delivery vehicles would operate in Miami. The two conducted a short test of pizza deliveries in Ann Arbor, Mich., in 2017.

partner.name: Connect Robotics
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Drones can be customized  for the the operation needed. Along with a web interface the following can be done: Track all your drones in real time; Follow delivery status (both sender and receiver); Check security approvals; Define new deliveries; Setup warehouses; Setup consumers; Setup and manage destinations; Abort flights.

partner.name: Starship Technologies
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Starship robots are advanced devices that can carry items within a 2-mile (3km) radius. Parcels and groceries are directly delivered from stores or specialised hubs, as soon as the customer requests so via a mobile app. It takes 5 to 30 minutes for the shipment to arrive and the robots’ entire journey can be monitored on a smartphone.

partner.name: Toyota e-Palette
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Toyota is developing a new autonomous vehicle able to make deliveries or heavy transportation. e-Palette has three sizes: small, medium and large. They're all the same width and height, only the length varies between vehicles.

partner.name: eatsa
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Enhance customer engagement, streamline ordering and fulfillment, make pickup a delight, and create efficiencies everywhere. eatsa is an end-to-end operating platform for restaurants that integrates digital and in-store experiences.

technology.name: Autonomous vehicles for Transportation
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Autonomous vehicles can improve delivery efficiency and logistics cost. An autonomous vehicle is one that can drive itself from a starting point to a predetermined destination in "autopilot" mode using various in-vehicle technologies and sensors, such as lasers, radar and cameras, as well as advanced driver assistance systems, software, map data, GPS and wireless data communication.

technology.name: Drones for Deliveries
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Unmanned aerial vehicles can deliver packages to customers in short periods of time, taking advantage of the zero-congestion and more direct air routes (at least for now).
technology.prevwork: A study is available. Drones are lacking maturity to be used for last mile deliveries.

technology.name: Advanced materials for Thermal insulated packaging
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Use special emergent materials to avoid having to actively refrigerate food products on delivery routes. Specific materials avoid the heat loss from the inside to the outside and can prevent heat transfer to the inside, allowing products to keep their temperature for much longer.

app_REWASTEP.label: Reward for each Consumer Journey Step

meta.description: Now that each individual is a continuous data generation machine, people expect a clear benefit for each step of their shopping experience. The ability to convert pain points into perks will be one of the main factors to earn people's preference.

partner.name: Gimbal
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: In app or via paid media, Gimbal has the tools to collect valuable data from existing or potential customers and reach any audience on mobile with relevant, captivating experiences.

partner.name: Crowdsight
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Crowdsight understands the audience's emotional reactions and engagement towards products, content and campaigns. They can collect important data on demographics such as age, gender and ethnicity.

partner.name: Prism SkyLabs
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Prism’s cloud service transforms any video camera into a visual merchandising, auditing, and business intelligence tool that can be accessed from any device. It can highlight where people spend time and what they interact with in any space.

partner.name: Swipii
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Swipii is a mobile app that links subscribing businesses with customer payment cards to provide automatic loyalty points that can be traded in for rewards

partner.name: Pavegen
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Pavegen creates high engagement with citizens by converting their footsteps into energy, data and rewards. We do this for smart cities and transport hubs, retailers, brands and educators. Apps, lighting, sounds and rewards provide instant feedback.

partner.name: Profila
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Profila is re-imagining customer relationships, putting you as the consumer in control of your privacy, your data and most importantly your experiences.

partner.name: YouClap
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: That feeling when your best friend dares you to do something? That’s what YouClap is all about.

partner.name: framie
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Framie is a mobile app that empowers any brand to create digital collections, composed of placeholder pictures, for their users to complete with their own pictures. Step up your user engagement game!

implementation.name: Sweat Coin
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: We convert your steps into sweatcoins, to spend on products and services. Walk, earn, spend, repeat. You’ll see, it pays to walk

implementation.name: Connected Products
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: While things like social media have helped extend a relationship that used to end at the shop door, a direct connection via the product itself opens up a whole new ball game.

meta.description:
Addressing the need to belong is the oldest commercial trick in the book. People want to be a part of something and brands must be able to address that social requirement. The good news is that the digital transformation that we're living in is boosting businesses' ability to do it.

The digital age is pushing peer pressure through the roof, which, for retailers, represents both an opportunity (the feeling of urgency and fear of missing out are sales drivers) and a threat (people's increasing desire to disconnect and to subscribe to digital detox programs or lifestyles).

implementation.name: MonsterInsight's "Who's buying what?"
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: These days, it’s not unusual to see live information on sales when you visit a website, as in this example from MonsterInsights. This shows the first name and location of a recent purchaser, so it’s clear it’s a real person. If visitors to your site know other people are buying, then they’ll want to buy too.

implementation.name: Online Shoppers Will Buy More If They See What Others Have Bought
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: It turns out that online shoppers are really just a bunch of copycats. According to new research, consumers are more likely to purchase items if information highlighting sales statistics from other customers accompanies product listings on websites.

implementation.name: This is exactly how many reviews it takes to get someone to buy something
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: But one is better than none, since research shows we favor merch with more reviews.

implementation.name: Today’s ‘try before you buy’ mindset is reshaping how people shop
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: When was the last time you bought something without consulting a review?

meta.description:
Brands are living inside their customers' pockets 24/7. The ability for retailers to create the feeling of emergency is, therefore, higher than it ever was. 

People want to both belong and feel unique at the same time and businesses have an unprecedented opportunity to take advantage of those (apparently) paradoxical needs.

implementation.name: Booking.com "Booked twice in the past 6 hours"
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Booking.com has a fantastic strategy for creating urgency & social proof at the same time to help book hotel stays.

implementation.name: FOMO Factory
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: This two-story interactive pop up shop celebrates the magic of childhood we often lose as adults, and what it is to feel wonder, awe, and silliness. Using the emerging medium of immersive art, The FOMO Factory envelopes all five senses and invites attendees to shamelessly snap selfies and play like a kid.

implementation.name: FÖMO
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: FÖMO is working on concepts that will benefit the community and will provide brands with the opportunity to engage with their customers. Similar to a micro-department store except that it is not just about the shopping, it is an event, exhibition and workshop venue.

partner.name: Eatizz Last-Minute Discounts
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Eatizz is a Canadian startup that offers a simple and clever solution to users which are notified when shopkeeper offer discounted food (close to sales’ expiry date, unsold products) in their neighborhood.

partner.name: Optionizr
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Let’s face it, when clients aren’t sure, they don’t buy. And nothing guarantees they’ll be coming back to your website once decided. By proposing an option early in the booking funnel, you create the first step towards the final purchase.

meta.description: Provide tools that deliver quick and relevant information for employees of customer care (call centres) to allow the written contact with several customers simultaneously.

implementation.name: Automation and Artificial Intelligence: How machines are affecting people and places
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: The report focuses on areas of potential occupational change rather than net employment losses or gains.

partner.name: Cisco/Musion Telepresence
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Eyeliner 3D by Musion offers a new and unique high definition video 3D hologram projector screen allowing spectacular freeform 3-dimensional holographic moving images to appear within a live stage setting

partner.name: Holovect
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: The Holovect is a self-contained laser-based volumetric display system that fits on a lab bench or desktop. The Holovect Mk II is the first commercially available, laser-based desktop "holographic" display, capable of drawing 3D objects in air with light.

partner.name: Looking Glass
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: This "personal volumetric display" lets you see in VR without a headset, letting you share such content with people around you. The display is also interactive so you can move things around either by swiping on the touch-sensitive screen, waving your hands in front of it or pairing up a gaming controller.

partner.name: Dreamoc HD3
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: This display is a great platform for grabbing attention in any busy commercial setting. With its size of less than two feet wide and one foot in height, the Dreamoc HD3 lets you tap into the curiosity of anyone passing by, making them stop and stare at your display by taking advantage of mixed reality.

partner.name: Omknee
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Employees use Omknee to meet customer inquiries or preferences and finalize sales faster

partner.name: talkdesk
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Talkdesk is loaded with advanced features that are strikingly simple and save time. For example, Callbar requires virtually no training and allows team members to view caller information without switching between tabs. Simplicity also means reliability. Talkdesk offers superior voice quality with six global data centers and Global Low Latency architecture.

technology.name: Artificial intelligence for Chatbots
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Chatbots allow us to get personalized information instantly. Chatbots are about delivering convenience, personalization, and decision support while people are multitasking. Either for customers on the go, to enable call center operators to get valuable information on-the-fly about the requirements of the multiple customers they are chatting with, or for sales associates to instantly access details about products and customers while assisting a client.
technology.prevwork: A previous study and a Proof-of-concept of a chatbot is about to be launched to assist post sales needs of Continente Online customers.

technology.name: Holograms for Products visualization
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Provide product launching campaings by displaying products using holograms. Images can be projected in 3D using light instead of using a conventional display. A Hologram is created and projected by the light rays into the air where they get reflected creating a visible image.
technology.prevwork: Commercial approaches are available to use this technology in marketing campains.

technology.name: Holograms for Virtual presence
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Video conferencing replaced by holographic video meetings with full scale projection of people. Image is captured in real-time with depth-sensing cameras. The image is then used in a VR, AR or holographic environment, enabling natural dialog to occur as if it were presentially.

meta.description: With robots and automation making more and more frequent appearances in our everyday lives, we are confronted with the progressive decrease in human interaction. Despite this, at our core, we are social animals, and we like being with other people (whether we "like" it or not). A consequence that comes from this is that people cast authenticity and humanity in a brighter light. Federico Marchetti said it beautifully when he predicted that "in the future there will be one label that will convey [a sense quality] to the customers - 'Made by Humans'". Making the right choices when it comes to automation isn't always limited to efficiency and cost. Allowing the human touch to permeate your products and services where it matters most, can be a powerful loyalty driver, justifying and even contradicting RPAs or seamlessness.

implementation.name: REI Yay Days
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: After receiving their Yay Day coupons, employees fill out a small card explaining "what they're 'yaying' about," which they sign and turn into their managers. It ties back to REI's commitment to helping people embark on adventures outside.

implementation.name: Track time on Social Media
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Apple, Google, Facebook are all implementing digital wellness features on their services to help users reclaim time they spend on their phones and apps.

implementation.name: Super Bowl Sad Robots
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Antonis Kocheilas, Global Leader, Brand Strategy, provides insights on the ads featured during the 2019 Super Bowl, an event where some argue that the ads are as important as the game itself.

partner.name: Affectiva
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Affectiva's emotion recognition tech is built with deep learning and is the world’s largest emotion database. Their software empowers digital experiences and enhances consumer insight.

partner.name: Crowdsight
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Crowdsight understands the audience's emotional reactions and engagement towards products, content and campaigns. They can collect important data on demographics such as age, gender and ethnicity.

technology.name: Artificial intelligence for Customer profiling
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Know in real-time the profile of customers as gender, age or mood. Sensors (e.g. cameras or microphones) capture customer's images or voice and the results are ran through algorithms. The output details the customer's profile such as mood, age or gender, which can be routed to sales associates or call center operators to deliver an appropriate service.

meta.description: Develop and offer a range of innovative products and services to address the need customers have to enjoy some off-time, and detox from everyday frenetic continuous connection.

implementation.name: Digital Detox Holidays
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: DigitalDetox is a website that helps users selecting hotels that are offering detox holidays to help them de-stress. No Wi-Fi, zero cell reception, a tech-free attitude and lots of human interactions are the main attractions of these experiences.

implementation.name: The No Phone
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: The least advanced phone, ever. The NoPhone is a technology-free alternative to constant hand-to-phone contact. With a thin, light and completely wireless design, the NoPhone acts as a surrogate to any smart mobile device.
